III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility did not request or require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
2

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The chief administrator
indicated the agency did not experience any barriers or difficulties in achieving
compliance. The agency experienced one child's plan change from a voluntary
direct consent adoption to a court ordered placement with a referral to DHHS. The
chief administrator reported the agency has had some staffing changes which
resulted in hiring new staff but there have been no concerns.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the agency's
budget and profit/loss statement.
Staff Interviews
Interviews were conducted with three staff face-to-face at the agency. Staff
reported feeling supported and did not report any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of adoption services. All files were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency does not certify foster homes, therefore, does not have an assigned
agency analyst.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
